title: Holocaust education in Iowa schools should paint the full picture
message:
Governor Kim Reynolds came to Beit Shalom, the home of the Quad Cities Jewish community, on May 15 to sign House File 2545, a bill containing controversial new social studies curriculum requirements.
Because the bill requires Iowa schools to teach Holocaust education, following the model of Illinois, which has required it for several years.
Though members of the Quad Cities Jewish community are divided about the policies of the governor and the Republican-controlled legislature, we do stand united on the issue of Holocaust education in our schools.
For most of the members of the Jewish community, Holocaust education is not only important as a reminder of the horrors of the past and as a memorial to the martyrs of the Holocaust, but also as a much needed safeguard for the future.
It is our deepest hope that when our Iowa schools teach about the Holocaust, they will paint a full picture of that dreadful chapter in world history.

title: Four pro - Palestine students , one pro - Israel protest in Kalama
message:
Four students from Kalama High School participated in a walk out protest near the end of the school day Wednesday in support of Palestine.
The brief protest was planned to be pro-Palestine, but one student also attended to support Israel and the U.S., and two Kalama residents unaffiliated with the school brought their children to hold American and Israeli flags after seeing the demonstrators.
The students gathered a few minutes outside of school property at an intersection on Elm Street, where they displayed signs urging for a ceasefire.
Senior Diego Luna joined the protest to support Israel and the U.S., and said he wanted to show his pride in America and make sure people were aware of deaths happening on both sides.
He displayed American and Israeli flags and held a sign given to him by the other students that read "this is not antisemitism."

title: The Forever Wars , MAGA and the Loneliness of Anger
message:
Surgeon General Vivek Murthy recently highlighted the problem, claiming that loneliness was as dangerous to our health as smoking 15 cigarettes a day.
Loneliness and a Lack of Self-ControlI’m a clinical social worker who treats Americans from all walks of life, including serving troops and veterans affected by our post-9/11 wars.
Its underbelly, however, is alienation, loneliness, and their close cousins, anger and fear.
And many of those who feel lonely and depressed are also angry.
What Donald Trump and other MAGA leaders have done is take emotions like loneliness and channel them into a social movement.
